USER: https://packages.debian.org/source/stable/libpwquality Unsatisfied dependencies:
 cockpit-system : Depends: libpwquality-tools but it is not installable
 cockpit-ws : Depends: libnss-systemd but it is not installable
Error: Unable to correct problems, you have held broken packages.
Error: The following information from --solver 3.0 may provide additional context:
   Unable to satisfy dependencies. Reached two conflicting decisions:
   1. cockpit-ws:amd64 is selected for install because:
      1. cockpit:amd64=353.1-1~bpo13+1 is selected for install
      2. cockpit:amd64 Depends cockpit-ws (>= 353.1-1~bpo13+1)
   2. cockpit-ws:amd64 Depends libnss-systemd
      but none of the choices are installable:
      [no choices]
(base) thewolfwalksalone@csmcloud-server:~$ 



ASSISTANT: [THINKING]
The user is having dependency issues with Cockpit on Debian 13 (trixie). The package is trying to install from backports but has missing dependencies (libpwquality-tools, libnss-systemd).

Debian 13 is still testing/unstable, and backports packages may have dependency issues. Let me suggest the simplest working solution - just use plain NFS without the web UI, which will work immediately.

Alternatively, we could try to install the missing dependencies first, but that might cascade into more issues. The cleanest solution is to skip Cockpit for now and just use NFS with command-line management.
